page.title: 11CATTLE IN CANNICH AREA
page.content:
{Cattle farming}in the area consists mainly of cross bred suckler cows many of which are on hill land during the Summer months.
Most calves are sold at store auctions to low ground farmers for "finishing". They are then slaughtered for meat.
Some farmers rear their own replace- ment heifers, others bring in dairy cross heifers. Some continental bulls are used although traditional{British {breeds}are still very evident.
Virtually no{dairy farming}is practised and it is rare even to find one cow kept to provide milk for use of farmer or farm workers.
